INDEX REVISIONS OVERVIEW FIELD SUMMARY
DATATYPES SQL SUMMARY TRIGGERS
Table : TBL_R_RECORDS

The Records Table holds Record Layout Header Details.

See Also:

TBL_RF_RECORDFIELDS
TBL_RS_SUBRECORDS

Field Summary
Name Type Description
RECORDID INTEGER

Primary Key of the Record Table. This key is used internally in the System and not displayed to the user.
RECORDNAME VarChar50

Record Name
DESCRIPTION VarChar250

Record Description
RECORDTYPE TINYINT

Record Type. There are Following Types

  1. Standard Record - Record contains a series of fixed Length field

  2. Binary Record - Record that will be read with the Binary IO routines (and may contain binary fields).

  3. Character Seperated (ie Comma Seperated Fields). These records are are only partially supported and may be removed

  4. Group of Sub Records - Record is Consists of several possible records. Typically there will be a RecordType field which determines which layout to choose.

  5. Group of Binary Sub Records like a Group of Sub Records only it consists of Binary Record

The posible values are held in the Record Type Table in the Table DB-Table and can be retrieved with the following sql

select TBLKEY, Details from TBL_TI_INTTBLS where tblid = 2
SYSTEM smallint

Holds the System. All the Systems are held in System Table in the Table-DB

Systems are held int Tables tables and can be retrieved with the following SQL

select TBLKEY, Details from TBL_TI_INTTBLS where tblid = 3
LISTCHAR Char_YN

Basically a Boolean; char field with a values of

  • Y - Yes

  • N - No

Char fields work better than Boolean in erly versions of Oracle
COPYBOOK Char11

Cobol Copybook name, used in the Cobol Import Process
DELIMITER Char7

Field Delimiter (i.e. in CSV Files)
QUOTE Char1

Quote (if any) for For CSV
POSRECIND INTEGER  
RECSEPLIST VarChar50

Record Seporator name (i.e. used in ComboBox).

RECORDSEP VarChar50

Record Seporator (Binary Records only)
EXTERNALID INTEGER

External Record ID - not important -was used importing from Excell Spreadsheets)
Canonical_Name VarChar30

Canonical Name of the Font. Normally left blank, but if you wish to view a EBCIC (ie Mainframe File) on a IBM PC you would

store Cp037 in this field.
Record_Style INTEGER

Record Style - provided for future use
FILE_STRUCTURE INTEGER

File Structure ~ control which IO routines are used to read the file.

Table 4 in Tbl_t_Table / TBL_TI_INTTBLS holds the available option (ie the following SQL will get the available options)

select TBLKEY, Details from TBL_TI_INTTBLS where tblid = 5
